verses.kjv: Then came to Jesus scribes and Pharisees, which were of Jerusalem, saying,
verses.web: Then Pharisees and scribes came to Jesus from Jerusalem, saying,
verses.ct: A group of Pharisees and scribes came from Jerusalem to confront Jesus.

verses.kjv: Why do thy disciples transgress the tradition of the elders? for they wash not their hands when they eat bread.
verses.web: “Why do your disciples disobey the tradition of the elders? For they don’t wash their hands when they eat bread.”
verses.ct: "Why do your disciples break the tradition of the elders?" they asked. "They don't even wash their hands before they eat."

verses.kjv: But he answered and said unto them, Why do ye also transgress the commandment of God by your tradition?
verses.web: He answered them, “Why do you also disobey the commandment of God because of your tradition?
verses.ct: Jesus fired back, "And why do you break God's commandment for the sake of your tradition?

verses.kjv: For God commanded, saying, Honour thy father and mother: and, He that curseth father or mother, let him die the death.
verses.web: For God commanded, ‘Honor your father and your mother,’ and, ‘He who speaks evil of father or mother, let him be put to death.’
verses.ct: God commanded, 'Honor your father and mother,' and 'Anyone who curses their father or mother must be put to death.'

verses.kjv: But ye say, Whosoever shall say to his father or his mother, It is a gift, by whatsoever thou mightest be profited by me;
verses.web: But you say, ‘Whoever may tell his father or his mother, “Whatever help you might otherwise have gotten from me is a gift devoted to God,”
verses.ct: But you teach that someone can say to their father or mother, 'Whatever money I might have used to help you has been dedicated to God' —

verses.kjv: And honour not his father or his mother, he shall be free. Thus have ye made the commandment of God of none effect by your tradition.
verses.web: he shall not honor his father or mother.’ You have made the commandment of God void because of your tradition.
verses.ct: and then they don't have to honor their parents at all. You've completely gutted God's commandment with your tradition.

verses.kjv: Ye hypocrites, well did Esaias prophesy of you, saying,
verses.web: You hypocrites! Well did Isaiah prophesy of you, saying,
verses.ct: You hypocrites! Isaiah was talking about you when he prophesied,

verses.kjv: This people draweth nigh unto me with their mouth, and honoureth me with their lips; but their heart is far from me.
verses.web: ‘These people draw near to me with their mouth, and honor me with their lips; but their heart is far from me.
verses.ct: 'These people honor me with their lips, but their hearts are nowhere near me.

verses.kjv: But in vain they do worship me, teaching for doctrines the commandments of men.
verses.web: And in vain do they worship me, teaching as doctrine rules made by men.’ ”
verses.ct: Their worship is worthless because they teach human rules as if they were God's commands.'"

verses.kjv: And he called the multitude, and said unto them, Hear, and understand:
verses.web: He summoned the multitude, and said to them, “Hear, and understand.
verses.ct: Then Jesus called the crowd over and said, "Listen carefully and understand this:

verses.kjv: Not that which goeth into the mouth defileth a man; but that which cometh out of the mouth, this defileth a man.
verses.web: That which enters into the mouth doesn’t defile the man; but that which proceeds out of the mouth, this defiles the man.”
verses.ct: It's not what goes into your mouth that makes you unclean. It's what comes out of your mouth — that's what makes you unclean."

verses.kjv: Then came his disciples, and said unto him, Knowest thou that the Pharisees were offended, after they heard this saying?
verses.web: Then the disciples came, and said to him, “Do you know that the Pharisees were offended when they heard this saying?”
verses.ct: His disciples came to him and said, "Do you realize the Pharisees were offended when they heard that?"

verses.kjv: But he answered and said, Every plant, which my heavenly Father hath not planted, shall be rooted up.
verses.web: But he answered, “Every plant which my heavenly Father didn’t plant will be uprooted.
verses.ct: Jesus replied, "Every plant that my heavenly Father didn't plant will be pulled up by the roots.

verses.kjv: Let them alone: they be blind leaders of the blind. And if the blind lead the blind, both shall fall into the ditch.
verses.web: Leave them alone. They are blind guides of the blind. If the blind guide the blind, both will fall into a pit.”
verses.ct: Ignore them. They're blind guides leading blind people. And when the blind lead the blind, both end up falling into a pit."

verses.kjv: Then answered Peter and said unto him, Declare unto us this parable.
verses.web: Peter answered him, “Explain the parable to us.”
verses.ct: Peter spoke up and said, "Explain this parable to us."

verses.kjv: And Jesus said, Are ye also yet without understanding?
verses.web: So Jesus said, “Do you also still not understand?
verses.ct: Jesus said, "Are you still not getting it?

verses.kjv: Do not ye yet understand, that whatsoever entereth in at the mouth goeth into the belly, and is cast out into the draught?
verses.web: Don’t you understand that whatever goes into the mouth passes into the belly, and then out of the body?
verses.ct: Don't you understand that whatever goes into your mouth passes through your stomach and leaves your body?

verses.kjv: But those things which proceed out of the mouth come forth from the heart; and they defile the man.
verses.web: But the things which proceed out of the mouth come out of the heart, and they defile the man.
verses.ct: But the things that come out of your mouth come from the heart — and those are what make a person unclean.

verses.kjv: For out of the heart proceed evil thoughts, murders, adulteries, fornications, thefts, false witness, blasphemies:
verses.web: For out of the heart come evil thoughts, murders, adulteries, sexual sins, thefts, false testimony, and blasphemies.
verses.ct: Because out of the heart come evil thoughts, murder, adultery, sexual sin, theft, lying, and slander.

verses.kjv: These are the things which defile a man: but to eat with unwashen hands defileth not a man.
verses.web: These are the things which defile the man; but to eat with unwashed hands doesn’t defile the man.”
verses.ct: These are the things that make a person unclean. Eating with unwashed hands doesn't make anyone unclean."

verses.kjv: Then Jesus went thence, and departed into the coasts of Tyre and Sidon.
verses.web: Jesus went out from there, and withdrew into the region of Tyre and Sidon.
verses.ct: Jesus left that area and traveled to the region of Tyre and Sidon.

verses.kjv: And, behold, a woman of Canaan came out of the same coasts, and cried unto him, saying, Have mercy on me, O Lord, thou son of David; my daughter is grievously vexed with a devil.
verses.web: Behold, a Canaanite woman came out from those borders, and cried, saying, “Have mercy on me, Lord, you son of David! My daughter is severely possessed by a demon!”
verses.ct: A Canaanite woman from that region came to him, crying out, "Have mercy on me, Lord, Son of David! My daughter is tormented by a demon!"

verses.kjv: But he answered her not a word. And his disciples came and besought him, saying, Send her away; for she crieth after us.
verses.web: But he answered her not a word. His disciples came and begged him, saying, “Send her away; for she cries after us.”
verses.ct: But Jesus didn't say a word to her. His disciples came and urged him, "Send her away — she keeps shouting after us."

verses.kjv: But he answered and said, I am not sent but unto the lost sheep of the house of Israel.
verses.web: But he answered, “I wasn’t sent to anyone but the lost sheep of the house of Israel.”
verses.ct: Jesus answered, "I was sent only to the lost sheep of the house of Israel."

verses.kjv: Then came she and worshipped him, saying, Lord, help me.
verses.web: But she came and worshiped him, saying, “Lord, help me.”
verses.ct: But the woman came and knelt before him. "Lord, help me," she pleaded.

verses.kjv: But he answered and said, It is not meet to take the children’s bread, and to cast it to dogs.
verses.web: But he answered, “It is not appropriate to take the children’s bread and throw it to the dogs.”
verses.ct: He replied, "It isn't right to take the children's bread and toss it to the dogs."

verses.kjv: And she said, Truth, Lord: yet the dogs eat of the crumbs which fall from their masters’ table.
verses.web: But she said, “Yes, Lord, but even the dogs eat the crumbs which fall from their masters’ table.”
verses.ct: "That's true, Lord," she said, "but even the dogs eat the crumbs that fall from their masters' table."

verses.kjv: Then Jesus answered and said unto her, O woman, great is thy faith: be it unto thee even as thou wilt. And her daughter was made whole from that very hour.
verses.web: Then Jesus answered her, “Woman, great is your faith! Be it done to you even as you desire.” And her daughter was healed from that hour.
verses.ct: Then Jesus said to her, "Woman, your faith is remarkable! What you've asked for is yours." And from that very moment, her daughter was healed.

verses.kjv: And Jesus departed from thence, and came nigh unto the sea of Galilee; and went up into a mountain, and sat down there.
verses.web: Jesus departed from there, and came near to the sea of Galilee; and he went up into the mountain, and sat there.
verses.ct: Jesus left there and went along the Sea of Galilee. He climbed a hillside and sat down.

verses.kjv: And great multitudes came unto him, having with them those that were lame, blind, dumb, maimed, and many others, and cast them down at Jesus’ feet; and he healed them:
verses.web: Great multitudes came to him, having with them the lame, blind, mute, maimed, and many others, and they put them down at his feet. He healed them,
verses.ct: Huge crowds came to him, bringing people who were lame, blind, mute, crippled, and many others. They laid them at Jesus' feet, and he healed them all.

verses.kjv: Insomuch that the multitude wondered, when they saw the dumb to speak, the maimed to be whole, the lame to walk, and the blind to see: and they glorified the God of Israel.
verses.web: so that the multitude wondered when they saw the mute speaking, the injured healed, the lame walking, and the blind seeing—and they glorified the God of Israel.
verses.ct: The crowd was amazed as they watched mute people speaking, crippled people made whole, lame people walking, and blind people seeing. They praised the God of Israel.

verses.kjv: Then Jesus called his disciples unto him, and said, I have compassion on the multitude, because they continue with me now three days, and have nothing to eat: and I will not send them away fasting, lest they faint in the way.
verses.web: Jesus summoned his disciples and said, “I have compassion on the multitude, because they continue with me now three days and have nothing to eat. I don’t want to send them away fasting, or they might faint on the way.”
verses.ct: Jesus called his disciples together and said, "My heart goes out to these people. They've been with me for 3 days now and have nothing left to eat. I don't want to send them away hungry — they might collapse on the way home."

verses.kjv: And his disciples say unto him, Whence should we have so much bread in the wilderness, as to fill so great a multitude?
verses.web: The disciples said to him, “Where should we get so many loaves in a deserted place as to satisfy so great a multitude?”
verses.ct: His disciples said, "Where could we possibly find enough bread out here in this remote place to feed such a huge crowd?"

verses.kjv: And Jesus saith unto them, How many loaves have ye? And they said, Seven, and a few little fishes.
verses.web: Jesus said to them, “How many loaves do you have?” They said, “Seven, and a few small fish.”
verses.ct: Jesus asked them, "How many loaves do you have?" They answered, "7, and a few small fish."

verses.kjv: And he commanded the multitude to sit down on the ground.
verses.web: He commanded the multitude to sit down on the ground;
verses.ct: He told the crowd to sit down on the ground.

verses.kjv: And he took the seven loaves and the fishes, and gave thanks, and brake them, and gave to his disciples, and the disciples to the multitude.
verses.web: and he took the seven loaves and the fish. He gave thanks and broke them, and gave to the disciples, and the disciples to the multitudes.
verses.ct: Then he took the 7 loaves and the fish, gave thanks to God, broke them into pieces, and handed them to his disciples, who distributed them to the crowd.

verses.kjv: And they did all eat, and were filled: and they took up of the broken meat that was left seven baskets full.
verses.web: They all ate, and were filled. They took up seven baskets full of the broken pieces that were left over.
verses.ct: Everyone ate until they were full, and when they collected the leftovers, they filled 7 baskets.

verses.kjv: And they that did eat were four thousand men, beside women and children.
verses.web: Those who ate were four thousand men, in addition to women and children.
verses.ct: The number of men who ate was 4,000 — not counting the women and children.

verses.kjv: And he sent away the multitude, and took ship, and came into the coasts of Magdala.
verses.web: Then he sent away the multitudes, got into the boat, and came into the borders of Magdala.
verses.ct: After sending the crowds on their way, Jesus got into a boat and crossed over to the region of Magdala.
